main event: Several witnesses reported sightings of an unidentified flying object in St. Croix Falls, Wisconsin, on October 7, 1951, which maneuvered in the sky and exhibited a bright glow.
interesting points: The object was observed continuously for about 30 minutes and was described as disc-shaped and emitting a reddish-orange glow., Multiple witnesses, including a U.S. Army patrol, confirmed the sighting, stating the object displayed a rapid and erratic flight path., Witness Kaliszewski described seeing space ships flying at terrific speeds with blue lights shining from them., Engineer Charles U. Moore described observing a peculiar circular gold-colored object about 100-200 feet in diameter moving across the sky at high speed., The air force's balloon explanation for the sightings was deemed insufficient and unconvincing by some witnesses.
sighted object: unidentified flying object, disc-shaped with a reddish-orange glow
location: St. Croix Falls, Wisconsin, United States
witness description: U.S. Army patrol and other civilians including Kaliszewski and Moore
